questions.questionText: 1)Which of the following option leads to the portability and security of Java?

options.text: b)The applet makes the Java code secure and portable

questions.explanation: Because JVM prevents the code from generating its side effects. The Java code is portable, as the same byte code can run on any platform.

questions.questionText: 2) _____ is used to find and fix bugs in the Java programs.
questions.explanation: The JVM (Java Virtual Machine) enables a computer to run Java or other language (kotlin, groovy, Scala, etc.) programs that are compiled to the Java bytecode. The JRE (Java Runtime Environment) is a part of JDK that contains the Java class libraries, Java class loader, and the Java Virtual Machine. The JDK (Java Development Kit) is a software development environment used to develop Java applications and applets.

questions.questionText: 3)What does the expression float a = 35 / 0 return?
questions.explanation: In Java, whenever we divide any number (double, float, and long except integer) by zero, it results in infinity.

questions.questionText: 4)Which method of the Class.class is used to determine the name of a class represented by the class object as a String?
questions.explanation: The getName() method of the Class class returns the name (as String) of the entity (class, interface) represented by this Class object. It is a non-static method, and available in the java.lang package.

questions.questionText: 5) Which of the following is true about the anonymous inner class?

options.text: c)It has a fixed class name

questions.explanation: Anonymous inner classes are the same as the local classes except that they don't have any name. The main use of it is to override methods of classes or interfaces.
